metadata.title: CVE-2019-8936 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
NTP through 4.2.8p12 has a NULL Pointer Dereference. It was discovered that the fix for CVE-2018-7182 introduced a NULL pointer dereference into NTP. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service (crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-8936` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu6
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu6
sntp - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu6
No subscription required

notes.note: leosilva> issue was introduced with the fix from CVE-2018-7182

criterions.comment: ntp package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu6').
